jobs.title: frontend Developer(Fresher
jobs.jobSummary: We are looking for a skilled Full Stack Developer to join our innovative team building a next-generation Human Resource Management System (HRMS). In this role, you will be responsible for developing and maintaining both front-end and back-end components of our platform, creating a seamless, intuitive, and powerful experience for HR professionals and employees alike. You will play a crucial part in the entire development lifecycle, from concept to deployment.
jobs.responsibilities: We are looking for a skilled Full Stack Developer to join our innovative team building a next-generation Human Resource Management System (HRMS). In this role, you will be responsible for developing and maintaining both front-end and back-end components of our platform, creating a seamless, intuitive, and powerful experience for HR professionals and employees alike. You will play a crucial part in the entire development lifecycle, from concept to deployment.
jobs.qualifications:
Design, build, and maintain efficient, reusable, and reliable code for our HRMS application.

Develop user-facing features and UI components using React.js and Tailwind CSS.

Build robust, scalable back-end services and APIs using Java and the Spring Boot framework.

Integrate front-end elements with server-side logic and database systems.

Collaborate with product managers, UX/UI designers, and other engineers to define and ship new features.

Write and maintain unit tests and integration tests to ensure code quality and application stability.

Participate in code reviews to maintain high standards of code quality.
jobs.preferredQualifications: We are looking for a skilled Full Stack Developer to join our innovative team building a next-generation Human Resource Management System (HRMS). In this role, you will be responsible for developing and maintaining both front-end and back-end components of our platform, creating a seamless, intuitive, and powerful experience for HR professionals and employees alike. You will play a crucial part in the entire development lifecycle, from concept to deployment.
jobs.companyOverview:
Of course! Here is a complete, filled-out example for a Full Stack Developer role, tailored to the kind of HR tech projects you've been working on.

Job Title *
Full Stack Developer (HR Tech Platform)

Location *
Coimbatore, Tamil Nadu, India

Work Model *
Hybrid

Job Summary *
We are looking for a skilled Full Stack Developer to join our innovative team building a next-generation Human Resource Management System (HRMS). In this role, you will be responsible for developing and maintaining both front-end and back-end components of our platform, creating a seamless, intuitive, and powerful experience for HR professionals and employees alike. You will play a crucial part in the entire development lifecycle, from concept to deployment.

Key Responsibilities *

Design, build, and maintain efficient, reusable, and reliable code for our HRMS application.

Develop user-facing features and UI components using React.js and Tailwind CSS.

Build robust, scalable back-end services and APIs using Java and the Spring Boot framework.

Integrate front-end elements with server-side logic and database systems.

Collaborate with product managers, UX/UI designers, and other engineers to define and ship new features.

Write and maintain unit tests and integration tests to ensure code quality and application stability.

Participate in code reviews to maintain high standards of code quality.

Required Qualifications (Must-Haves) *

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.

2+ years of professional experience in full-stack web development.

Strong proficiency in Java and experience with the Spring Boot framework.

Solid experience with front-end technologies, including React, JavaScript (ES6+), HTML5, and CSS3.

Experience with RESTful API design and implementation.

Familiarity with relational databases like PostgreSQL or MySQL.

Proficient with version control systems, particularly Git.

Preferred Qualifications (Nice-to-Haves)

Hands-on experience with Tailwind CSS for building modern user interfaces.

Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud).

Knowledge of containerization technologies like Docker and Kubernetes.

Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and automated testing frameworks.

Experience working in an Agile/Scrum development environment.

Previous experience developing HRMS or enterprise-level SaaS applications.

Salary Range
₹12,00,000−₹18,00,000 per annum (commensurate with experience)

Company Overview & Culture
InnovateHR is a fast-growing tech startup dedicated to revolutionizing the world of human resources. We believe in building powerful tools that are a joy to use. Our culture is built on collaboration, continuous learning, and a passion for solving complex problems. We foster a flat hierarchy where every voice is heard and good ideas can come from anywhere.

jobs.eeoStatement:
Comprehensive health insurance for you and your family.

Flexible working hours and a hybrid work model.

Generous paid time off and parental leave.

Annual budget for professional development and learning.

Team outings, events, and a well-stocked pantry.

Employee stock option plan (ESOP).

jobs.title: Backend Developer (Fresher)
jobs.jobSummary: We are seeking a skilled Backend Developer to join our dynamic technical team. You will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining the server-side logic, databases, and APIs that power our applications. The ideal candidate has a passion for building robust, scalable, and high-performance systems and enjoys working collaboratively to solve complex technical challenges.
jobs.responsibilities:
Design, build, and maintain efficient, reusable, and reliable Java code.

Develop server-side logic, business rules, and core application components for our platform.

Design, implement, and document scalable and secure RESTful APIs to power front-end applications and third-party integrations.

Contribute to architectural decisions and help evolve our microservices-based infrastructure.

Implement security and data protection best practices throughout the application.

Database & Data Management
Design and manage database schemas, ensuring data integrity and performance.

Write complex and optimized SQL queries, stored procedures, and data migration scripts.

Integrate data storage solutions, including relational databases (like PostgreSQL, MySQL) and NoSQL databases.

Ensure the performance, quality, and responsiveness of applications to handle data-intensive operations.
jobs.qualifications:
Here are the required qualifications for a backend developer, often listed as "must-haves."

Required Qualifications (Must-Haves)
Education & Experience
A bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, or a related field.

0-1 years of professional, hands-on experience in a backend software development role.

Proven experience working on the full software development lifecycle, from conception and design to deployment and maintenance.
jobs.preferredQualifications:
Cloud Platform Experience

Hands-on experience with a major cloud provider like AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud Platform (GCP). Specific experience with services like EC2, S3, RDS, or Lambda is a big plus.

Containerization & Orchestration

Familiarity with containerization using Docker and container orchestration with Kubernetes.

DevOps & CI/CD

Knowledge of CI/CD (Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment) principles and experience with tools like Jenkins, GitLab CI, or GitHub Actions.

Messaging Systems

Experience with message brokers like RabbitMQ or Apache Kafka for building asynchronous, event-driven applications.

Additional Database Knowledge

Familiarity with NoSQL databases (e.g., MongoDB, Redis) and an understanding of when to use them.

Advanced Testing

Experience with advanced testing frameworks and concepts, such as Mockito for mocking or performance and load testing.

Development Methodologies

Experience working in an Agile/Scrum team environment.

Industry-Specific Experience

Previous experience developing software for SaaS platforms or specific knowledge of the HR Tech industry.
